tires.description: Tire pressure has an effect on peak grip, responsiveness and wear. Excessively high or low pressures can adversely affect the contact area.

gearing.description: Final Drive ratio adjusts the entire gear set simultaneously. Higher ratio = Acceleration, Lower ratio = Top Speed.

alignment.description: Adjust camber, toe and caster to optimize the tire contact patch during cornering and straight line stability.

springs.description: Spring stiffness affects how the car supports its weight and absorbs bumps. Ride height affects the center of gravity and aerodynamic downforce.

damping.description: Damping controls how quickly the suspension compresses (bump) and extends (rebound). It fine-tunes the transition of weight during braking, acceleration, and cornering.

aero.description: Aerodynamic downforce increases grip at high speeds but adds drag, which reduces top speed.

brake.description: Brake balance adjusts the distribution of braking force between front and rear. Pressure affects the maximum braking force applied.

differential.description: The differential controls how power is distributed between the left and right wheels (or front and rear axles). It affects traction and cornering behavior.

arbs.description: Anti-roll bars link the left and right suspension components. Stiffer bars reduce body roll but can make the suspension less independent.
